$orderby.name: $orderby
$orderby.description:
An OData query option to fetch ordered data

    https://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/odata/v4.01/odata-v4.01-part1-protocol.html#sec_SystemQueryOptionorderby

$own.name: $own
$own.description: If only the resources created by the authenticated app member should be included

$select.name: $select
$select.description:
The OData `$select` query option.

    This is a comma separated string of fields to select. Only filtering flat properties is
    supported.

    http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/odata/v4.01/odata-v4.01-part1-protocol.html#sec_SystemQueryOptionselect

$skip.name: $skip
$skip.description: Start the query from an offset.

$top.name: $top
$top.description: Limit the number of entities returned.

appVariableId.name: appVariableId
appVariableId.description: The id of the app variable on which to perform an operation

assetId.name: assetId
assetId.description: The ID of the asset on which to perform an operation

blockId.name: blockId
blockId.description: The ID of the block on which to perform an operation, but without the organization scope.

blockVersion.name: blockVersion
blockVersion.description: The version of the block on which to perform an operation.

delimiter.name: delimiter
delimiter.description: Delimiter to be used to parse the CSV file

endpoint.name: endpoint
endpoint.description: The URL of the endpoint associated with the subscription.

groupId.name: groupId
groupId.description: The ID of the group on which to perform an operation

groupMemberId.name: groupMemberId
groupMemberId.description: The id of the group member on which to perform an operation

language.name: language
language.description: The language on which to perform an operation

organizationId.name: organizationId

organizationSubscriptionId.name: organizationSubscriptionId
organizationSubscriptionId.description: The ID of the subscription on which to perform an operation

readmeId.name: readmeId
readmeId.description: The id of an app readme

resourceId.name: resourceId
resourceId.description: The ID of the resource on which to perform an operation

resourceType.name: resourceType
resourceType.description: The type of the resource on which to perform an operation

roles.name: roles
roles.description: The roles of app members on which to perform an operation

screenshotId.name: screenshotId
screenshotId.description: The id of an app screenshot

seed.name: seed
seed.description: Whether the resources or assets are seed instead.

selectedGroupId.name: selectedGroupId
selectedGroupId.description: The currently selected group of the app member.

serviceSecretId.name: serviceSecretId
serviceSecretId.description: The id of the app service secret on which to perform an operation

trainingId.name: trainingId
trainingId.description: Id of the training on which the operation will be performed.

view.name: view
view.description: The view of the resource to fetch.

webhookName.name: webhookName
webhookName.description: The name of the webhook to call

webhookSecretId.name: webhookSecretId
webhookSecretId.description: The id of the app webhook secret on which to perform an operation

schema.description: A representation of a user’s OAuth2 consent when logging in to an app.

redirectUri.description: The URI to redirect the user back to.

scope.description: The OAuth2 scope requested by the app.

assets.description: A list of assets that should be linked to the resource.

schema.description: A mapping of resources names to resource subscriptions.

App.description: An app definition defines what an app will look like.

id.description:
The unique identifier for the app.

This value will be generated automatically by the API.

path.description:
The URL path segment on which this app is reachable.

This may only contain lower case characters, numbers, and hyphens. By default this is a
normalized version of the app name.

domain.description:
The domain name on which this app should be served.

If this is unspecified, the app will be served from the path on the domain of the server
`HOSTNAME` variable.

visibility.description:
Determine the app visibility of the app in the Appsemble app store.

This doesn’t affect whether or not the app can be accessed on its own domain.

- **public**: The app is publicly listed in the Appsemble app store.
- **unlisted**: The app store page can be accessed, but the app isn’t listed publicly in the
  Appsemble app store.
- **private**: The app is only visible to people who are part of the organization.

showAppDefinition.description: Whether or not people who have access to the app may see the app definition.

locked.description:
Determines whether this app should be locked from being updated.
      If this is set to `fullLock`, no changes can be made to the app,
      if this is set to `studioLock`, no changes can be made from the studio but updating from the CLI is possible,
      and to make any changes from the studio, this should be set to `unlocked`.

displayAppMemberName.description: Whether to display app member name in the title bar.

displayInstallationPrompt.description: Whether to display installtion prompt to the users of app

template.description: Determines whether this app should be included when fetching for templates.

demoMode.description: Determines whether this app should be used in demo mode.

longDescription.description:
A long description for the app.

The long description will be rendered on the app details page. Markdown content is supported.

definition.description: An app definition describes what an Appsemble app looks like.

screenshotUrls.description: A list of URLs referencing app screenshots

googleAnalyticsID.description: If this is specified, Google analytics will be applied to the app

sentryDsn.description:
The Sentry DSN to use for this app.

If this is specified, the given Sentry DSN will be used for error tracking. Apps without a custom
domain fall back to use the Appsemble server Sentry DSN.

sentryEnvironment.description:
The name that should be used as the sentry environment.

  This is only applied when `sentryDsn` is specified.

controllerCode.description: Custom app logic as a JavaScript string

AppAccount.description: An object representing a member of an app

app.description: The app this account is for.

sso.description: The single sign on configurations which link the user to an external account.

id.description: The unique ID of the app collection.

name.description: The name of the app collection.

OrganizationId.description: The ID of the organization that owns the app collection.

OrganizationName.description: The name of the organization that owns the app collection.

visibility.description: The visibility of the app collection.

profileImage.description: The URL at which the expert’s profile image can be found.

headerImage.description: The URL at which the app collection’s header image can be found.

$created.description: When the collection was first created as an ISO 8601 formatted string

$updated.description: When the collection was last updated as an ISO 8601 formatted string

name.description: The name of the app collection.

visibility.description: The visibility of the app collection.

expertName.description: The name of the app collection’s expert/curator.

expertDescription.description: The description of the app collection’s expert/curator.

expertProfileImage.description: The profile image of the app collection’s expert/curator.

headerImage.description: The header image of the app collection.

AppMember.description: An object representing a member of an app

id.description: The id of the app member.

role.description: The role of the app member within the app.

name.description: The full name of the app member.

email.description: The email address of the app member.

AppMemberInfo.description: An object representing the OAuth2 info of a member of an app

sub.description: The id of the app member.

name.description: The full name of the app member.

email.description: The email address of the app member.

email_verified.description: Whether this email address has been verified.

picture.description: The URL of the profile picture of the app member.

locale.description: The locale of the app member.

zoneinfo.description: The time zone of the app member.

role.description: The role of the app member within the app

properties.description: The custom properties of the app member.

AppMessages.description: The response object of an messages create call.

force.description: If this is true, the app lock is ignored.

AppOAuth2Secret.description: Settings for login in apps using third party OAuth2 providers

tokenUrl.description: The URL to request access tokens from.

clientId.description: The public client id which identifies Appsemble to the authorization server.

icon.description: A Font Awesome icon which represents the OAuth2 provider.

name.description: A display name which represents the OAuth2 provider.

scope.description: The login scope that will be requested from the authorization server.

userInfoUrl.description: The URL to request user info from

remapper.description: A remapper to apply on retrieved user information from the user info endpoint.

created.description: When the secret was created originally.

updated.description: When the secret was last updated.

name.description: An optional name to give extra clarity what the secret is used for.

urlPatterns.description: The url pattern that is matched when a proxied request action is called.

authenticationMethod.description: The method to authenticate the request action with.

identifier.description: The parameter name, header name, username or certificate that goes with the secret.

secret.description: The secret to authenticate the proxied outgoing request with.

tokenUrl.description: The URL to request access tokens from.

scope.description: The scope to request access tokens for.

public.description: If a secret is marked public, it can be applied to the unauthenticated users, e.g. in the requests originating in a custom sign up or login page.

name.description: The name of the variable, that will be accessible from clients.
An optional name to give extra clarity what the secret is used for.

webhookName.description: The name of the webhook the secret is tied to

secret.description: The autogenerated secret to authenticate the webhook caller with.

AppsembleMessages.description: A mapping of the messages for this language

core.description: Translations for the core of the app.

app.description: Translations for global block messages and meta properties of the app.

blocks.description: Translations for the core of the app.

additionalProperties.description: The name of the block type.

messageIds.description: A list of custom message IDs used by the app.

Asset.description: The response object of an asset publish call.

id.description: The unique identifier for the asset.

mime.description: The IANA MIME type of the asset.

name.description: The given name of the asset. Assets may be referenced by their name or ID in the API.

BlockVersion.description:
A version of a block definition

Block versions can’t be updated or deleted. This ensures apps that use a block version can never
be broken by alterations of block definitions.

name.description:
The name of a block.

This uses the same form as scoped npm packages. For example, `@appsemble/form`.

longDescription.description: The long description of the block.

icon.description: An icon to represent the block in Appsemble studio.

iconUrl.description: The relative URL on which the icon is served

version.description: A [semver](https://semver.org) representation of the block version.

visibility.description:
Whether the block should be listed publicly for users who aren’t part of the block’s organization.

- **`public`**: The block is visible for everyone.
- **`unlisted`**: The block will only be visible if the user is logged in and is part of the block’s organization.

layout.description:
How the block will be displayed on the screen.

- **`float`**: The block will float somewhere on the screen.
- **`grow`**: The block will be positioned in the main page. It will grow to fill up remaining
  space on the page.
- **`static`**: The block will be positioned in the main page. It will take up a fixed amount of
  space.
- **`hidden`**: The block will not be rendered at all.

actions.description:
An object which describes the actions a block can trigger.

This will be used to validate app definitions.

parameters.description:
A draft 7 JSON schema to use for block parameter validation.

If the parameters of a block definition don’t conform to this schema, the app definition will be
considered invalid.

events.description: An object describing the names of the events the block can listen and emit to.

listen.description: A mapping of events this block may listen on

additionalProperties.description: A mapping of events this block may listen on

emit.description: A mapping of events this block may emit

additionalProperties.description: A mapping of events this block may emit

messages.description:
The translated messages for the block.

English (`en`) messages are required.

en.description: A mapping of language IDs to their English translation

additionalProperties.description: A mapping of language IDs to their internationalized translation
The translated messages for this language.

files.description: A list of file assets that belong to the app version.

examples.description: A list of exmples how the block can be used within an app definition.

wildcardActions.description:
Whether action validation for wildcard action is skipped.

If true, ignore unused actions that fall under '$any'.

Error.description: The generic error object returned by any expected API errors.

statusCode.description: Matches the HTTP response status code.

error.description: Matches the HTTP response status description.

GroupMember.description: An object representing a member of a group

id.description: The id of the app member.

role.description: The role of the app member within the group.

database.description: Whether or not the database status is healthy

description.description: A description for the user to recognize the client.

expires.description: When the client credentials expire automatically.

scopes.description: The scopes that have been granted to the client.

Organization.description: An organization groups a set of users, apps, themes, and permissions together

id.description: The unique identifier for the organization.

name.description: The display name for the organization.

email.description: The email address of the organization.

iconUrl.description: The URL used to fetch the organization’s icon.

vatIdNumber.description: The VAT id number of the organization.

streetName.description: Street name that will appear on the invoice.

city.description: City where the organization is located

countryCode.description: Country code of the country where the organization is located

invoiceReference.description: The reference identifier that will appear on the invoices.

stripeCustomerId.description: Stripe internal ID of the customer used to match it with the organization in our database.

primaryEmail.description: The primary email address of the user.

properties.description: Additional custom properties that a user might have.

OrganizationSubscription.description: A subscription holds permission to what the users withing an organization are allowed to do.

id.description: The unique identifier for the subscription.

cancelled.description: Whether the subscription will be renewed at the end.

cancellationReason.description: Users reasoning for cancelling the subscription.

expirationDate.description: The expiration date of the subscription.

subscriptionPlan.description: The plan associated with the subscription.

renewalPeriod.description: The renewal period associated with the subscription.

organizationId.description: The unique identifier for the organization.

Rating.description: A representation of an App rating.

rating.description: A value ranging from 1 to 5 stars rating of the App.

description.description: An optional explanation of the given rating.

name.description: The name of the user who submitted the rating.

Resource.description: A resource can be anything defined as described in an app resource definition.

ResourceSubscription.description: This describes how a user is subscribed to a resource.

create.description: If true, the user is subscribed to any create actions for the resource type

update.description: If true, the user is subscribed to any update actions for the resource type

delete.description: If true, the user is subscribed to any delete actions for the resource type

subscriptions.description: A mapping of resource IDs to individual resource subscriptions

additionalProperties.description: The subscription status of a user for a single resource.

update.description: If true, the user is subscribed to update actions on this particular resource.

delete.description: If true, the user will be notified when this particular resource is deleted.

SSLSecret.description: The SSL secret of an app.

certificate.description: The public SSL certificate chain in PEM format.

key.description: The SSL private key in PEM format.

SSOConfiguration.description: A single sign on configuration which is exposed to users.

url.description: The URL users will be redirected to in the login process.

name.description: A user readable name for the configuration.

operations.description: Patch operations to apply to the resource

anyOf.description: A SCIM patch single replace operation
A SCIM patch bulk replace operation

enabled.description: Whether or not SCIM is enabled for the app.

ScimUser.description: The definition of a user according to the SCIM documentation.

userName.description: A unique identifier for the user (generally maps to the Azure AD user principal name)

meta.description: Read-only metadata maintained by the service provider

items.description: A user's email. By default, one of these should be of type 'work' and have 'primary' set to true. Value contains actual address

TrainingCompleted.description: Object which stores that a user has completed a certain training

trainingId.description: The training that the user has completed.

userId.description: The user who completed the training

UserEmail.description:
An email address that is linked to a user.

    Users may use any of their email addresses to login.

email.description: The email address that is registered

verified.description: Wether or not the email address has been verified by the user.

UserInfo.description: An object representing the OAuth2 info of a user

name.description: The full name of the user.

email_verified.description: Whether this email address has been verified.

picture.description: The URL of the profile picture of the user.

timezone.description: The time zone of the user.

subscribed.description: If the user is subscribed to the newsletter.

app.description:
OAuth2 login for apps.

    The authorization code flow is recommended. The password flow exists for legacy apps and will be
    removed in the future.

scopes.openid: Login the user to the requesting app using OpenID.
scopes.profile: Read the user profile, including the display name and profile picture.
scopes.resources:manage: Manage app resources on behalf of a user.
scopes.groups:read: Read the groups the user is a part of.
scopes.groups:write: Add new members to a group.

scopes.openid: Login the user to the requesting app using OpenID.
scopes.profile: Read the user profile, including the display name and profile picture.
scopes.resources:manage: Manage app resources on behalf of a user.
scopes.groups:read: Read the groups the user is a part of.
scopes.groups:write: Add new members to a group.

basic.description: Used for logging in to the web interface

cli.description:
OAuth2 login for client credentials.

    For example the Appsemble CLI uses this.

scopes.blocks:write: Register and update blocks, and publish new block versions.
scopes.resources:read: Read app resources on behalf of a user.
scopes.resources:write: Modify app resources on behalf of a user.
scopes.assets:write: Create app assets on behalf of a user.
scopes.groups:read: Read information about the user’s groups.
scopes.groups:write: Read information about the user’s groups.

studio.description: Used for authenticating requests made using Appsemble studio interface.

info.title: Appsemble
info.description:
Welcome to the Appsemble API.

The app studio can be found on
> https://appsemble.app:9999

The OpenAPI explorer can be found on
> https://appsemble.app:9999/api-explorer

parameters.description: The id of the app collection to pin the app to

parameters.name: appId
parameters.description: The id of the app to pin

200.description: The app was pinned to the app collection

parameters.description: The id of the app to unpin

204.description: The app was unpinned from the app collection

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The path to the action to execute.

requestBody.description: The data that was passed to the action

get.description: Check if an app has clonable assets.

200.description: Whether the app has clonable assets.

parameters.description: App that is creating the checkout.

stripeWebhookSecret.description: The private secret used for authenticating app related Stripe webhooks.

successUrl.description: The url users are redirected to after successfully completing app related Stripe checkout session.

cancelUrl.description: The url users are redirected to after unsuccessfully completing app related Stripe checkout session.

requestBody.description: Information about the payment sent by Stripe forwarded to an app webhook.

externalId.description:
The external id of the of the external user.

The `externalId` maps to the following ids of the external login methods.
- Appsemble OAuth2 login: `UserId`
- App OAuth2 login: `sub`
- App SAML login: `nameId`

secret.description: The secret that was used to get the external id.

get.description:
Get the app member information formatted as OpenID user info.

      See https://connect2id.com/products/server/docs/api/userinfo

name.description: The full name of the end-user

picture.description: The URL of the profile page for the end-user.

profile.description: The URL to the app member profile.

email_verified.description: True if the end-user’s email address has been verified, else false.

patch.description: Update the data of the currently logged in app member

locale.description: The preferred locale of the user.

get.description: Fetch all members of an app.

parameters.description: Whether the language’s messages should be merged with its base language.

parameters.name: override
parameters.description: Whether the app’s language overrides should be included and merged.

limit.description: Maximum number of emails that can be sent today

stripeApiSecretKey.description: The API key to use for Stripe authentication. This gets encrypted when stored.

stripeWebhookSecret.description: The secret to use for verifying incoming webhooks. This gets encrypted when stored.
